member.name: T:GLImp.Camera
member.summary: Base class for all Camera Types.

member.name: F:GLImp.Camera.Layer
member.summary: Layer used for ordering cameras. Higher layers are drawn on top of lower layers.

member.name: F:GLImp.Camera.OnRender
member.summary: The OnRender event will be triggered whenever the camera is ready to start drawing.

member.name: M:GLImp.Camera.DisableViewport
member.summary: Disables viewports. This camera will fill up the window.

member.name: M:GLImp.Camera.EnableViewport(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Enables viewports.
member.param: Pixels from the left of the draw area.
Pixels from the top of the draw area.
Width of the camera in pixels.
Height of the camera in pixels.

member.name: M:GLImp.Camera.Disable
member.summary: Disables this camera from being drawn.

member.name: M:GLImp.Camera.Enable
member.summary: Re-Enables a disabled camera. All created cameras are enabled by default.

member.name: P:GLImp.Camera.Viewport
member.summary: Returns the current viewport area. Setting this will enable viewports.

member.name: M:GLImp.Image.Draw(OpenTK.Vector2d,OpenTK.Vector2d)
member.summary: Draws the image at the specified position and size.

member.name: M:GLImp.Image.Draw(OpenTK.Vector2d)
member.summary: Draws the image at the specified position.

member.name: M:GLImp.Image.Draw(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Draws the image at the specified position.
member.param: X Position to draw the image.
Y Position to draw the image.

member.name: M:GLImp.Image.Draw(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Draws the image at the specified position and size.
member.param: X Position to draw the image.
Y Position to draw the image.

member.name: M:GLImp.GraphicsManager.OpenWindow
member.summary: Starts the game.

member.name: M:GLImp.GraphicsManager.Start
member.summary: Starts the game. Same exact thing as OpenWindow.

member.name: M:GLImp.GraphicsManager.DrawPolygon(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{OpenTK.Vector2d})
member.summary: Draws a triangle strip with the given input

member.name: T:GLImp.DisplayList
member.summary: Captures a collection of GL calls to quickly call them all at once in the future.

member.name: M:GLImp.DisplayList.#ctor
member.summary: Generates a new Display List.

member.name: M:GLImp.DisplayList.BeginCapture
member.summary: Begin capturing OpenGL calls. This will intercept the calls and stop them from being executed.

member.name: M:GLImp.DisplayList.PassiveCapture
member.summary: Begin capturing OpenGL calls. This will allow the calls to also be executed, passivly collecting them.

member.name: M:GLImp.DisplayList.EndCapture
member.summary: Ends the current capture sequence.

member.name: M:GLImp.DisplayList.Draw
member.summary: Draws (or replays) the collected capture sequence. Use BeginCapture/PassiveCapture and EndCapture to collect GL calls.

member.name: T:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkHeader
member.summary: Structure used to store the header information of an MDF chunk.

member.name: F:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkHeader.id
member.summary: The unique ID tag of this header, defining which type of data resides in the chunk.

member.name: F:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkHeader.size
member.summary: The size of the entire chunk, including this header, in octet bytes.

member.name: F:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkHeader.offset
member.summary: The byte offset in the file at which this header was retrieved. Ignored for header writing purposes.

member.name: T:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkReader
member.summary: Represents a reader that can be used to read files stored in the Mila Data File format. The reader is not thread-safe! One MDFChunkReader per thread and vice versa please.

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkReader.#ctor(System.IO.BinaryReader)
member.summary: Creates a new MDFChunkReader wrapped around the existing BinaryReader object.
member.param: the existing opened BinaryReader to use.

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkReader.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new MDFChunkReader opened on the given file. If the file cannot be opened for reading, throws an IOException.
member.param: The filepath to the file to open.

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkReader.findNextChunk(Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkHeader,System.UInt32,System.Int64)
member.summary: Searches for a top-level chunk with a given id inside of the given container chunk. This method assumes that starting with the offset given, there is nothing in the container chunk besides chunks written one after another. Any stray data between chunks is unexpected.
member.param: The id of the chunk to look for.
The starting offset from the beginning of the container chunk data to apply.
member.returns: The header of the chunk found, or a header with an offset of -1 if none is found.

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkReader.peekChunkHeader
member.summary: Retrieves and returns the chunk header at the current location in the file, but does not advance the file position.
member.returns: The chunk header read.

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkReader.isEmpty(Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkHeader)
member.summary: Returns true if the given chunk is empty.
member.param: The header of the chunk to test.
member.returns: true if the given chunk is completely empty (in which the size field only accounts for the header), false otherwise.

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkReader.enterChunk(Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkHeader)
member.summary: Skips over the given chunk header, positioning the file position at the beginning of the chunk's data.
member.param: The chunk header of the chunk to enter.

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkReader.skipChunk(Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkHeader)
member.summary: Skips the current chunk by seeking past its size.
member.param: The header of the chunk to skip over.

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkReader.readUInt32
member.summary: Reads in a UInt32 value.
member.returns: The value read in.

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkReader.readInt32
member.summary: Reads in an Int32 value.
member.returns: the value read.

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkReader.readFloat
member.summary: Reads in an IEEE 32-bit doubleing point number.
member.returns: the value read.

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkReader.readUVInt32
member.summary: Reads in a UInt32 packed in a special variable-length encoding. If the first byte is 0xFE, then reads in the next two bytes as a short. If the first byte is 0xFF, then reads in the next four bytes as an int. Otherwise, reads in the first byte as the value.
member.returns: The value read as a UInt32

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkReader.readVInt32
member.summary: Reads in an Int32 packed in a special variable-length encoding. If the first byte is 0x81 (-127), then reads in the next two bytes as a short. If the first byte is 0x80 (-128), then reads in the next four bytes as an int. Otherwise, reads in the first byte as the value.
member.returns: The value read as an Int32

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkReader.readUVIntArray
member.summary: Reads in an array of UInts stored in a variable-length encoding.
member.returns: An array with the appropriate UInt32s.

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkReader.readVIntArray
member.summary: Reads in an array of Ints stored in a variable-length encoding.
member.returns: An array with the appropriate Int32s.

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkReader.readString
member.summary: Reads in a size-prefixed string encoded in UTF-16 Unicode.
member.returns: the value read.

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkReader.close
member.summary: Closes this reader.

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkReader.tell
member.summary: Returns the position in the stream.
member.returns: the position in the stream, in bytes from 0.

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkReader.seek(System.Int64)
member.summary: Seeks to the given position in the stream.
member.param: The byte offset in the stream to seek to.

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkReader.seekEnd
member.summary: Seeks the stream to the end (where next write occurs, etc).

member.name: T:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkWriter
member.summary: Represents a writer that can be used to write files stored in the Mila Data File format. The writer is not thread-safe! One MDFChunkWriter per thread and vice versa please.

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkWriter.#ctor(System.IO.BinaryWriter)
member.summary: Creates a new MDFChunkWriter object wrapped around the given existing BinaryWriter. If the writer is null, throws an ArgumentNullException.

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkWriter.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new MDFChunkWriter object bound to a BinaryWriter created for the given filepath. If the file could not be opened, throws an IOException.
member.param: The path to the file to write to.

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkWriter.close
member.summary: Closes this writer and flushes all of the data.

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkWriter.writeChunkHeader(Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkHeader)
member.summary: Writes the chunk header and returns a new header with an offset field marking the place where the header was written.

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkWriter.writeCalculatedChunkSize(Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkHeader)
member.summary: Calculates the size of the chunk from the current file position back to the start of the chunk header and writes that size into the chunk header. The size is corrected straight into the file, and the file position is reset back to the end of the chunk.
member.param: The chunk header of this chunk.
member.returns: The updated chunk header structure, with the new corrected size field (just in case anyone needs it).

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkWriter.writeInt32(System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes an Int32 value

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkWriter.writeUInt32(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Writes a UInt32 value.

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkWriter.writeFloat(System.Double)
member.summary: Writes an IEEE 32-bit doubleing-point number.

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkWriter.writeUVInt32(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Writes a UInt32 as a variable-length encoded value.

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkWriter.writeVInt32(System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a Int32 as a variable-length encoded value.

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkWriter.writeUVIntArray(System.UInt32[])
member.summary: Writes an array of UInt32s using variable-length encoding.

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkWriter.writeVIntArray(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Writes an array of Int32s using variable-length encoding.

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkWriter.writeString(System.String)
member.summary: Writes a Unicode UTF-16 size-prefixed string.

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkWriter.tell
member.summary: Returns the stream position at this current location.
member.returns: the stream position at this current location.

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkWriter.seek(System.Int64)
member.summary: Seeks to the given position in the stream.
member.param: the position to seek to, in bytes.

member.name: M:Mila.Utility.MDF.MDFChunkWriter.seekEnd
member.summary: Seeks to the end of the stream.

member.name: M:GLImp.MouseManager.SetMousePositionWindows(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Change the mouse position in the current window.
member.param: X position to set the mouse to.
Y position to set the mouse to.

member.name: M:GLImp.MouseManager.GetMousePositionWindows
member.summary: Returns the mouse position for windows machines, which is relative to the top left of the window.

member.name: M:GLImp.MouseManager.GetMouseWheel
member.summary: Gets the numbler of clicks (positive for up, negative for down) the scroll wheel has moved since last update.
member.returns: How far the mouse wheel has been scrolled.

member.name: P:GLImp.MouseManager.PreviousMousePosition
member.summary: Returns the previous mouse position. Mostly used for trackign how far the mouse has moved since last update.

member.name: P:GLImp.MouseManager.MousePosition
member.summary: Returns the mouse position relative to the top left corner of the viewable area, in pixels.

member.name: T:Mila.Types.Point3D
member.summary: Represents a point in 3D-space.

member.name: M:Mila.Types.Point3D.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new point that represents the origin.

member.name: M:Mila.Types.Point3D.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a new point with the given set of coordinates.

member.name: M:Mila.Types.Point3D.#ctor(Mila.Types.Vector3D)
member.summary: Creates a new point from the given position vector.
member.param: The position vector to create a point from.

member.name: M:Mila.Types.Point3D.Set(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets new value from the given coordinates.

member.name: M:Mila.Types.Point3D.Set(Mila.Types.Vector3D)
member.summary: Sets new value from the given vector.

member.name: M:Mila.Types.Point3D.Set(Mila.Types.Point3D)
member.summary: Sets new value from the given point.

member.name: P:Mila.Types.Point3D.X
member.summary: Gets or sets the x coordinate of this point.

member.name: P:Mila.Types.Point3D.Y
member.summary: Gets or sets the y coordinate of this point.

member.name: P:Mila.Types.Point3D.Z
member.summary: Gets or sets the z coordinate of this point.

member.name: M:GLImp.GraphicObjects.Shape.ColorToRgba32(System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Converts a System.Drawing.Color to a System.Int32.
member.returns: A System.Int32 containing the R, G, B, A values of the given System.Drawing.Color in the Rbga32 format.

member.name: M:GLImp.Textures.TextureFont.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a TextureFont object. The sent-in textureId should refer to a texture bitmap containing a 16x16 grid of fixed-width characters, representing the ASCII table. A 32 bit texture is assumed, aswell as all GL state necessary to turn on texturing. The dimension of the texture bitmap may be anything from 128x128 to 512x256 or any other order-by-two-squared-dimensions.

member.name: M:GLImp.Textures.TextureFont.WriteString(System.String)
member.summary: Draw an ASCII string around coordinate (0,0,0) in the XY-plane of the model space coordinate system. The height of the text is 1.0. The width may be computed by calling ComputeWidth(string). This call modifies the currently bound 2D-texture, but no other GL state.

member.name: F:GLImp.Textures.TextureFont.AdvanceWidth
member.summary: Determines the distance from character center to adjacent character center, horizontally, in one written text string. Model space coordinates.

member.name: F:GLImp.Textures.TextureFont.CharacterBoundingBoxWidth
member.summary: Determines the width of the cut-out to do for each character when rendering. This is necessary to avoid artefacts stemming from filtering (zooming/rotating). Make sure your font contains some "white space" around each character so they won't be clipped due to this!

member.name: F:GLImp.Textures.TextureFont.CharacterBoundingBoxHeight
member.summary: Determines the height of the cut-out to do for each character when rendering. This is necessary to avoid artefacts stemming from filtering (zooming/rotating). Make sure your font contains some "white space" around each character so they won't be clipped due to this!

member.name: M:GLImp.Textures.TextureFont.ComputeWidth(System.String)
member.summary: Computes the expected width of text string given. The height is always 1.0. Model space coordinates.

member.name: M:GLImp.Textures.TextureFont.WriteStringAt(System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: This is a convenience function to write a text string using a simple coordinate system defined to be 0..100 in x and 0..100 in y. For example, writing the text at 50,50 means it will be centered onscreen. The height is given in percent of the height of the viewport. No GL state except the currently bound texture is modified. This method is not as flexible nor as fast as the WriteString() method, but it is easier to use.

member.name: T:Mila.Data.Face
member.summary: Represents an n-vertex polygon in 3D-space.

member.name: T:Mila.Data.VertexAttributes
member.summary: Represents a set of attributes relevant to how a vertex is drawn on a particular face.

member.name: T:Mila.Utility.MM.MMReaderErrors
member.summary: Enumerates all of the different errors that can occur during reading.

member.name: T:Mila.Utility.MM.MMWriterErrors
member.summary: Contains a list of errors that can arise while trying to write the Model.

member.name: T:Mila.Types.Plane
member.summary: Represents a plane in 3D-space.

member.name: M:Mila.Types.Plane.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new plane with a null vector and zero distance.

member.name: M:Mila.Types.Plane.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a new plane with the given components.

member.name: M:Mila.Types.Plane.#ctor(Mila.Types.Vector3D,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a new plane from the given normal vector and a distance.

member.name: P:Mila.Types.Plane.C
member.summary: Gets or sets the c component of the plane.

member.name: P:Mila.Types.Plane.D
member.summary: Gets or sets the d component of the plane.

member.name: M:GLImp.Camera2D.CenterOnTarget(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set to true if the location of the camera is the center of the screen. Set it to false for the location to be the top right.

member.name: M:GLImp.Camera2D.SetZoom(System.Double)
member.summary: Set the magnification of the camera. "2" will make everything twice as big.
member.param: What you want to set the zoom level to.

member.name: M:GLImp.TextureManager.InitTexturing
member.summary: Initialize OpenGL state to enable alpha-blended texturing. Disable again with GL.Disable(EnableCap.Texture2D). Call this before drawing any texture, when you boot your application, eg. in OnLoad() of GameWindow or Form_Load() if you're building a WinForm app.

member.name: M:GLImp.TextureManager.CreateTextureFromFile(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create an OpenGL texture (translucent or opaque) by loading a bitmap from file. 24- and 32-bit bitmaps supported.

member.name: M:GLImp.TextureManager.CreateTextureFromBitmap(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create an OpenGL texture (translucent or opaque) from a given Bitmap. 24- and 32-bit bitmaps supported.

member.name: T:Mila.Types.Rotation
member.summary: Represents a free rotation in 3D space.

member.name: M:Mila.Types.Rotation.#ctor(Mila.Types.Rotation)
member.summary: Creates a new rotation object by cloning another.

member.name: M:Mila.Types.Rotation.equals(Mila.Types.Rotation)
member.summary: Returns true if the two rotations are equivalent.
member.param: The other rotation to compare against.
member.returns: true if the two rotations are equivalent.

member.name: M:Mila.Types.Rotation.set(Mila.Types.Rotation)

member.name: P:Mila.Types.Rotation.Tilt

member.summary: Converts a 2D screen space coordinate into a 3D world space coordinate.

member.summary: Converts a 2D screen space coordinate into a 3D ray.
member.param: The X,Y coordinate in the viewport that you wish to convert.
member.returns: A ray relative to the position of the camera.

member.name: T:Mila.Data.Vertex
member.summary: Represents a simple coordinate triple.

member.summary: Holds all the relevant information for a texture.

member.name: F:GLImp.Texture.UserData
member.summary: User data associated with this texture. This is never touched by GLImp, and exists purely for user convenience.

member.summary: Creates a new texture with the specified parameters.

member.name: M:GLImp.Texture.#ctor(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new texture with the specified parameters.

member.name: P:GLImp.Texture.Location
member.summary: The location this file was loaded from. Null if the file was created from a Bitmap.

member.name: P:GLImp.Texture.ID
member.summary: The OpenGL generated TextureID.

member.name: P:GLImp.Texture.LinearFilter
member.summary: Used to control the Linear Filter of this image. True = Smooth False = Pixely

member.name: P:GLImp.Texture.Clamp
member.summary: Used to control what happens if you draw beyond the edge of the image. True = Edge pixels are repeated (clamping the texture cooradinates at [0, 1]) False = The texture is repeated.

member.name: P:GLImp.Texture.Image
member.summary: The bitmap representation of the loaded image.

member.summary: Returns the cross product of this vector and another.
